With their pursuit of Mbeumo still ongoing, United are highly unlikely to get him and a striker through the door ahead of the opening game of the Premier League Summer Series against West Ham United in New Jersey on July 27.

It means the responsibility of leading United's attack in the US is likely to rest on the shoulders of either Rasmus Hojlund or Chido Obi. The former has not had a full pre-season at United after arriving too late in August 2023 and getting injured in the first game of last summer's tour.

Obi, too, has not had a pre-season since joining United. He joined the club last September and had to go through what was essentially an individual pre-season before being unleashed for the Under-18s and later graduating to the first-team.

Hojlund scored just ten goals last season, meaning justifiable doubts have been raised about him leading United's attack in 2025/26. The Reds are open to selling him and Inter Milan have expressed interest in his signature.
Hojlund has regressed since joining United and a lot of supporters have given up on him. There is no doubt the club needs to recruit a new starting striker this summer.

But until United oversee a crop of sales, they will be unable to fund the addition of a No.9 amid the £62.5m signing of Cunha and the ongoing pursuit of Mbeumo. United will also owe £89m on signings from previous windows this summer.
With patience required, Obi will be looking to make his mark in pre-season and potentially leapfrog Hojlund in the pecking order in the race to become Amorim's first-choice No.9 in the US.

The talented 17-year-old ended last season on a positive note, scoring two goals in United's 3-1 win over Hong Kong on the post-season tour. It goes without saying the outcome of that match meant nothing and the second half goals Obi plundered have not even made the record books.

However, the Danish youth international demonstrated in that second half that he has the natural instincts all good strikers need to have. His opener saw him swivel inside the box and fire home an instinctive finish before he anticipated a Mason Mount cross to head home his second.
His movement to ensure he was in the right place at the right time was down to his natural instincts, which is something that can be rarely taught on the training ground.

It must be stressed that this is not an argument for Obi to become United's main striker come the start of the season. There is an obvious need for the Reds to recruit an established goalscorer to spearhead their attack this summer.
But with their striker search no closer to being solved, Amorim could throw caution to the wind in pre-season and look ahead to United's long-term future by giving Obi the nod.
What is the worst that can happen?

headline: Man United transfer news LIVE - Bryan Mbeumo latest, Dusan Vlahovic talks, Victor Osimhen update
body: Hello and welcome to our live blog on the very latest Manchester United transfer news on Friday, July 11.
Ruben Amorim's men are back in pre-season training at Carrington as preparations for the 2025/26 get underway. However, there remains a big focus on United's transfer business.

Matheus Cunha has already arrived from Wolves for £62.5million but the Reds have struggled to get a deal over the line for Bryan Mbeumo. Two bids have been turned down by Brentford and a third bid has been tipped.

Alongside the 25-year-old, United are also exploring the possibility of signing a new striker. A move for Victor Osimhen and Viktor Gyokeres has been mentioned for the majority of the summer but Amorim is facing being short on options.

Free agents Jamie Vardy, Callum Wilson and Dominic Calvert-Lewin have all reportedly been offered to United. A move for either is expected to only be sanctioned closer to the end of the window, if other top targets aren't signed.
Keep across all the latest United transfer news and analysis in our live blog updates below...
Real Madrid have rejected a £78million bid from Manchester United for Aurelien Tchouameni, according to Spanish journalist Eduardo Inda.
United have been tracking Tchouameni's progress and are keen to strengthen their midfield following the departure of Christian Eriksen. The Frenchman would be a strong addition.
Barcelona are prepared to go 'all-in' to sign Marcus Rashford from Manchester United this summer, as per Sky Germany.

Journalist Florian Plettenberg said in a post on X, formerly known as Twitter, on Friday morning: "As revealed on 6 July, the priority for FC Barcelona is Marcus #Rashford. Barca want to try again for Rashford and are prepared to go all-in."
Plettenberg added: "Rashford is now the clear number one target. Talks are ongoing. Green light from Hansi Flick was already given days ago. The 27-year-old winger is set to leave Manchester United."

Rashford scored four times and provided six assists in 17 appearances during a loan spell at Aston Villa last season. He is one of five United players that have informed the club of his desire to explore different opportunities this summer.
Manchester United have reached a 'basic agreement' with Juventus regarding the transfer of Jadon Sancho, according to La Stampa.
Sancho, 25, has given the greenlight to make the move to Turin, with United agreeing to sell him in a deal worth around £17.2million.
The England international, who spent last season on loan at Chelsea, is expected to sign a long-term contract and earn £5.1m per year at Juventus.
Manchester United are open to allowing Andre Onana to leave the club for as a little as £30million this summer, according to the Daily Mail.
Monaco enquired about the possibility of signing the Cameroon international and £30m was the figure that United put forward, as they look to cash in on the goalkeeper.
If the Reds decided to sell for that price, it would represent a significant financial hit on the £47m they paid Inter Milan to sign Onana two years ago.
Manchester United have enquired about a potential move for Southampton star Tyler Dibling, according to The Sun. The 19-year-old impressed during his breakthrough Premier League season in 2024/25.
However, Saints value the teenager at £47million. As well as United, Tottenham, Nottingham Forest and West Ham are keen on signing the wide forward.
Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford drove into Carrington on Thursday to train on his own again. Rashford, 27, arrived at Carrington at 4.47pm, eight minutes after Ruben Amorim had departed.
United sources have denied Rashford was attending Carrington to discuss his future and said the 27-year-old has been training in the afternoons on an individual basis this week.
Rashford arrived through the back gate entrance at Carrington, and Amorim used the front gate.
Read the full story here.
Manchester United are considering a summer swoop for Dominic Calvert-Lewin, who is available as a free agent after leaving Everton at the end of last month, according to CaughtOffside.
Calvert-Lewin, 28, scored just three goals in 26 Premier League appearances last season and it's claimed he is a 'serious' target for United, but wages could prove to be an issue.
Calvert-Lewin is expected to ask for around £100,000 per week - a demand that could come as too expensive for the Reds.
Atalanta goalkeeper Marco Carnesecchi is Manchester United's top target for that position, according to reports in Italy.
He made 44 appearances in all competitions last season and kept 18 clean sheets - 13 in Serie A and five in the Champions League.
However, any deal for Carnesecchi may be dependent on Andre Onana's future and a move for the Cameroonian.
According to 90min.com, Juventus are keen to offload Dusan Vlahovic this summer and Manchester United are showing interest.
It's added that United may have the edge after opening talks over a swap deal involving out-of-favour winger Jadon Sancho.
Vlahovic, 25, scored 17 goals in 44 appearances during the 2024/25 season and netted against Manchester City at the Club World Cup.
Hello and welcome to our live Manchester United transfer news blog on this fine Friday morning.
Stay tuned for the latest throughout the day from Old Trafford...
Thank you for joining us on the United transfer blog tonight.
We will be back again bright and early tomorrow bringing you more updates from Old Trafford.
Until then, take care of yourselves and good night.
After a cryptic post on social media of himself on a private jet with the simple caption: "Coming," it appears Garnacho is free to train with the Reds' first-team.
Despite being told by Amorim that he is free to find a new club this summer, ESPN understands that the Argentine will not be blocked from training with his teammates when he returns to Carrington.

Garnacho is one of five players who informed United that he wished to sign for another club in the summer transfer window. He was therefore given an extended break to try and facilitate a deal elsewhere.
It is hard to argue against what Ferdinand is saying about Mbeumo.
United have got themselves too deep into this saga not to sign the Cameroonian now.
Not signing Mbeumo would be a huge come down for the Reds and risks being a very bad start to the summer transfer window.
Tomorrow, there will be 37 days remaining until the start of the Premier League season and United have only made one major signing...
Speaking on his podcast, Rio Ferdinand has insisted that United have little choice but to meet Brentford's valuation of Bryan Mbeumo this summer.

United need to find a way of meeting Brentford's valuation. The proposal doesn't seem to be enough for Brentford, but Manchester United need to get this done. It's been in the news for far too long, to get to a situation to get to the end of the window and it doesn't happen, I think that will be an egg-on-the-face situation for Man United unless they go and get someone else. Who have they got waiting in the wings as an alternative? We haven't heard any names that are close.
Despite these reports of a delay in negotiations between Napoli and Galatasaray for Osimhen, it seems this ship has sailed for United.
The Reds are still focused on Mbeumo and that could be to their detriment.
Osimhen will be given a hero's welcome back to Istanbul should he complete this move and you have to think that United could have missed a trick.
According to Gianluca Di Marzio, Napoli have paused transfer talks with Galatasaray for Victor Osimhen.
It is understood that there has been a delay to the move due to Gala's current inability to provide 'bank guarantees'.
As such, the talks have been halted until these guarantees have been met.
United confirmed this afternoon that young defender Sonny Aljofree has left the club to join Notts County on loan.
The 20-year-old made 25 appearances for Accrington Stanley last season in League Two and he returns to that level with the Nottinghamshire club.
In 2022, Aljofree starred alongside Garnacho and Mainoo as the young Reds won the Youth Cup.
According to Sport, Antony has a burning desire to sign for Real Betis in the summer transfer window.
It is understood that there is currently no agreement in place with the Seville club at this stage.
MEN Sport understands that Antony is one of five players who has told the club he wants to leave this summer.
Real Betis are reportedly confident enough that Antony wants to sign for them that they are willing to drag the saga into the final stages of the window to force United's hand.
According to Cameroon's assistant Ashu Cyprian Besong, Mbeumo is growing increasingly frustrated by the lack of movement in the switch to United.
Speaking to Telecom Asia, Besong said:

Yes, obviously he’s very frustrated with how long it’s taken. But he’s a professional and anticipates these things. I spoke to him about a week ago and he is very calm with everything that is going on. But of course, he’s already told them he wants to go to United. He just wanted the two clubs to find an agreement, as he’s very grateful for the opportunity that he’s been given by Brentford in his career.
It is being reported this evening that Nottingham Forest's Morgan Gibbs-White is set for a medical at Tottenham after Spurs activated his release clause.

With that, David Ornstein reports that Forest have renewed their interest in Brentford's Yoane Wissa and with money coming in for both Gibbs-White and Elanga, the east Midlands club have money to spend.
Yesterday we brought you news that the Bees are only willing to allow one of Wissa or Mbeumo to leave this summer.
At the moment, there has yet to be a breakthrough in negotiations with Brentford for Mbeumo so Forest's interest in Wissa could be a concern.
Hello and welcome to the United transfer blog.
My name is Jack Flintham and I shall be taking you through the rest of the evening with all the latest United news as and when we get it.
We are going to start with a deal which could impact United's Mbeumo bid.
Manchester United are being linked with several potential new signings as the summer transfer window rolls on.

One area of the pitch that has become the centre of the transfer speculation is at centre forward. Rasmus Hojlund and Joshua Zirkzee are the current striker options at United, but there are rumours that there could be new additions to the position at Old Trafford this summer.
Matheus Cunha has been signed from Wolves, with the £62.5million new addition also capable of performing in a centre forward role.

United had hoped to sign Liam Delap from Ipswich Town this summer, but the striker instead chosen to join Chelsea in a £30million deal. As a result, United have been looking at alternate options for the centre forward position, with a host of players being linked with a move to Old Trafford.
You can read more here.

The England international, 27, spent last season on loan at Aston Villa - after falling down the pecking order under Ruben Amorim and his time at the club appears to be drawing to an end. Rashford is reportedly keen on a move to La Liga side Barcelona, who are looking to bolster their forward line.
Barca's recent move for Nico Williams appeared to end any pursuit of the United forward, only for a dramatic twist which saw the Spanish international agree new terms with Athletic Bilbao.

It's re-opened the door for Rashford, who is still pushing for an exit from United, though recent reports may have handed him yet another blow. Hansi Flick's team have also been linked with a move for Liverpool winger Luis Diaz, along with Bayern Munich and clubs in Saudi Arabia.
You can read more here.
Manchester United look unlikely to sign Napoli striker Victor Osimhen who is closing in on a move to Turkish Super Lig side Galatasaray.
The Nigerian international spent last season on loan, helping them win a league and cup double, scoring 37 goals in 41 appearances.
On July 9th, Tavolieri tweeted: "Victor Osimhen's now pushing to make it happen in Galatasaray. His choice's clear now."

He has since given an update on talks, posting on X: "The path is clear for Victor Osimhen to join Galatasaray. As explained yesterday, the player is pushing for Napoli to accept a deal with the Turkish club. Al Hilal FC is out of the race. Everything is in place to finalize the move."
Victor Osimhen transfer update
Manchester United are still chasing a deal for Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo. The Reds are back in training this week, having secured two new signings.

United activated the £62.5 million release clause in Matheus Cunha's contract earlier this month, bringing the Wolves forward to Old Trafford on a five-year deal with an option for an extra year. Additionally, Paraguayan left-back Diego Leon has joined the club.

United's pre-season friendlies kick off against Leeds United in Stockholm on July 19. Following their trip to Sweden, they will jet off to the United States to participate in the Premier League Summer Series, where they will square off against West Ham, Bournemouth, and Everton.

There was optimism at Old Trafford that Mbeumo could link up with his potential new colleagues ahead of a pivotal pre-season for Ruben Amorim's squad. However, as of Thursday afternoon, a move has yet to materialise.
You can read more here.
20-year-old Manchester United defender Sonny Aljofree will spend the 2025/26 campaign with League Two club Notts County after the two clubs agreed a deal.
Aljofree spent last season on loan with Accrington Stanley, making 25 appearances in League Two. The defender has also spent time with National League side Altrincham and is a regular ar youth level.
He has captained Man United's U21s side and was part of the 2022 FA You Cup winning squad, playing alongside Kobbie Mainoo and Alejandro Garnacho.
Aljofree was also part ofthe first-team's pre-season fixtures against Wrexham in 2023 and Rosenborg in 2024.
Ruben Amorim welcomed back a number of Manchester United stars to pre-season training this week ahead of their 2025-26 Premier League campaign.
The likes of Rasmus Hojlund and Casemiro were seen entering Carrington training ground this week, as two of the players with an uncertain future.
Bruno Fernandes and Patrick Dorgu were also among those to retun to training.

United have delayed Antony, Alejandro Garnacho, Tyrell Malacia, Marcus Rashford and Jadon Sancho's return to training with all five given a period of extended leave to sort transfers away from Old Trafford.
Welcome back, lads!
Manchester United and Brentford could be set for another round of transfer negotiations - according to reports from the national media.

United are currently aiming to sign Bryan Mbeumo as their second new addition to their squad this summer. The Bees have already rejected two bids from United for the 25-year-old, with the latter worth more than £60million including add-ons.

There is still plenty of time for United to complete their transfer business for the summer, while it seems another deal has emerged as a possibility. And should the deal prove to be genuine, it would see United needing to enter negotiations with Brentford once again.

Caught Offside have reported that Yoane Wissa is now a concrete target for United this summer. The report has claimed that United will battle Tottenham Hotspur for the signing of the 28-year-old - who scored 20 goals in all competitions last season.
Wissa is now reported to be valued at around £50million by Brentford, with United also facing competition from Newcastle for the in-demand forward's signature.
You can read more here.
Manchester United's search for a striker goes on with their options continuing to dwindle this summer.

Liam Delap was heavily linked towards the end of 2024/25, but the Reds' failure to qualify for the Champions League appears to have cost them there after he opted to join Chelsea. Viktor Gyokeres was another option with his links to United boss Ruben Amorim from their time at Sporting together, making many feel it was a perfect match.
And yet another Premier League rival in Arsenal appears set to win that particular race. The Reds must now look at other options once they conclude a deal for Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo.

Juventus star Dusan Vlahovic has been tentatively linked for some time, and United may now have the perfect opportunity to sign him. Journalist Gianluca Di Marzio claims that Juventus are looking to cut his £20million-a-year wages.
You can read more here.
Corriere dello Sport claim that AS Roma boss Gian Piero Gasperini views Rasmus Hojlund as his dream signing to lead the line for the Serie A outfit.
Roma are reportedly closing in on a deal to sign Brighton forward Evan Ferguson on loan with an option to buy, but Gasperini remains a big fan of Hojlund despite his struggles at Old Trafford.
The report claims Roma would make a move to sign the Danish forward - who Gasperini signed at his former club Atalanta - should Artem Dovbyk leave this summer.
It adds that United would be looking for a fee in the region of €40m-€50m for Hojlund. (£35m-£43m)

headline: Tom Heaton explains how he is trying to support Manchester United's new signings
body: Goalkeeper Tom Heaton has explained how he wants to educate Manchester United's new signings about life at Old Trafford.
Heaton signed a new contract at United last month, extending his stay by a further year. His previous contract was up at the end of last season but United chose to extend his stay.
Although the goalkeeper, who will turn 40 next April, has not made a first-team appearance for the Reds since February 2023, he is a valued member of the squad.
He is a popular figure inside the dressing room and has been part of the squad's leadership group.

Able to offer no shortage of experience, Heaton, despite his hunger to continue playing, is happy to be able to offer guidance and support to new recruits, such as Matheus Cunha and Diego Leon, who started training with their new teammates earlier this week.
"My priority is playing and working hard to try and get in the team," Heaton told United's club website.

"That's always the priority, but as a senior player, and someone who signed at 11, left aged 24 and came back at 35, the values of this football club are ingrained inside me and I want to make sure that new players who come into the building have an understanding of what the club means to the fans, what the traditions are, what the values are, as well as accepting that it also requires a period to evolve.
"I see that as part of my role, being supportive. Even with the new players, Matheus and Diego coming through the door, offering that support if they need anything."

Heaton added: "I think it's about driving yourself and people see that, so people see that when you're at it, you're doing things properly, that's the first marker. It's a big part of it in my position at this moment.
"And Bruno [Fernandes] and I have a brilliant relationship, so I try and help him in any way I possibly can. I think he does a magnificent job."

headline: Jadon Sancho could be handed surprise Man United exit route but needs Liverpool transfer favour
body: Jadon Sancho could be handed a surprise exit route out of Manchester United this summer, but it would require a favour from rivals Liverpool.

Having spent last season on loan at Chelsea, the out-of-favour 25-year-old is expected to leave Old Trafford on a permanent basis this summer. Sancho is one of five United players granted extra time off to find a new club, with Serie A giants Juventus rumoured to be among his suitors.

However, the latest reports from Germany suggest another possible exit route could be on the cards, and it’s not his former club. Sancho was signed from Bundesliga side Borussia Dortmund in 2021 and spent the second half of the 2023/24 season back there on loan.

According to outlet TZ, Sancho could be a target for Bayern Munich this summer as they look to bolster their left-wing options following the departure of Leroy Sane. Given the player's prior Bundesliga experience and relatively low asking price compared to other targets, he could represent a strong option for Vincent Kompany.

The report also notes that Bayern were among the top European clubs interested in Sancho prior to his return to England, but it was United who eventually won the race for the winger. Now, he could be available to Bayern at a reasonable fee as the Manchester club look to offload players deemed surplus to requirements.

However, other reports in Germany claim Liverpool's Luis Diaz is Bayern’s priority target this summer, after they missed out on Nico Williams, who ultimately extended his contract at Athletic Club. That said, Liverpool have twice rejected approaches from Barcelona and Bayern for Diaz this summer, according to the BBC, and insist he is not for sale, despite only having two years left on his deal at Anfield.

Should Liverpool remain firm in their stance on the Colombian, Bayern will be forced to consider alternative targets. If reports are to be believed that Sancho is among them, it could provide a promising exit route for the United man.

headline: Emi Martinez to Man United door 'opens' as Aston Villa transfer moves closer
body: Manchester United could be handed a boost in their pursuit of Aston Villa's Emiliano Martinez, as the Midlands club are reportedly close to completing a deal for a new goalkeeper.

United have been strongly tipped to bolster their goalkeeping ranks this summer amid uncertainty over the long-term suitability of Andre Onana. Martinez is one of several names to have been linked with a move to Old Trafford in recent months.

Martinez has been at Villa for almost five years, having joined the club from Premier League side Arsenal in 2020. While he only made 38 appearances for the Gunners during his 10 years at the club, he has since established himself as a key figure at Villa Park, amassing over 200 appearances across all competitions.

The World Cup winner still has four years remaining on his current deal with Villa, but some reports this summer have suggested the club would be open to a sale for the right price in an effort to reduce their wage bill, leading to rumoured interest from the likes of United and clubs in Saudi Arabia.

Now, if the latest reports are to be believed, Villa are closing in on the signing of Dutch goalkeeper Marco Bizot. According to The Mirror, the 34-year-old is set to join from Ligue 1 side Brest and is eager to test himself in the Premier League.

The report notes that Villa are in the market for a new goalkeeper due to ongoing uncertainty surrounding Martinez’s future, as well as the departure of their no.2, Robin Olsen, who left as a free agent earlier this summer. With Villa covering their bases, it remains to be seen whether Bizot’s arrival could pave the way for Martinez’s exit.

The Argentina star addressed his future while away with his national team earlier this summer, telling reporters: “My future? I don’t know. I come here to play for the national team, and that’s the only thing that matters to me right now.
“Do I want to move to a new club? The transfer window just opened, so there’s still a long way to go.”

headline: 'Proud' - Enzo Kana-Biyik shares message after completing Manchester United transfer
body: Striker Enzo Kana-Biyik has said he is "very happy and proud" to have completed his move to Manchester United.
United unveiled the teenager as their latest summer signing on Thursday after arriving from French club Le Havre. He is understood to have signed a long-term contract at Old Trafford.
The 18-year-old will spend the upcoming season on loan at Swiss side Lausanne-Sport, who are owned by Ineos. The loan spell has been organised to assist him with his development.
Having officially finalised his switch to M16, the youngster has explained just how delighted he is to have got the deal over the line.
He posted on Instagram: "I am very happy and proud to announce the signing of my first professional contract at Manchester United.
"Thank you to this historic club for trusting me and I hope that I can leave my mark there. It's a new chapter of my life that is starting, new goals to achieve but the mindset is the same.
"A big thank you all the people who contributed to my development, my coaches, my teammates and my family.
"May all the glory return to God because without him nothing of everything I could have done would be possible."

Described as an "exciting young forward" by United in their statement confirming his arrival at Old Trafford, Kana-Biyik will be determined to make the most of his time in Switzerland and make his mark in a first-team environment for the first time.
He made the bench for Le Havre's first-team twice during his time in France, most recently for their 2-1 away win over Lille in February.

headline: 'Strong competition' - transfer interest in Man United youngster revealed after deal finalised
body: Notts County director of football Roberto Gagliardi has revealed the League Two side had to see off "strong competition" from clubs in League One to sign Manchester United defender Sonny Aljofree.
The 20-year-old centre-back finalised a switch to Meadow Lane on Thursday, joining the club on a season-long loan deal.
He is the first player to have left Old Trafford on loan this summer and more are expected to follow in the coming weeks.

The defender, who signed his first professional contract at United in May 2023, spent last season on loan at fellow League Two club Accrington Stanley and made 27 appearances across all competitions, chipping in with three goals.
His performances for the Lancashire outfit did not go unnoticed, with Magpies chief Gagliardi admitting League One sides were keen on signing the United youngster this summer.

Explaining what Aljofree will bring to Meadow Lane, Gagliardi told the Magpies' club website: "Sonny has all the traits of a modern-day defender – balancing an aggressive playing style with the ability to distribute the ball from the back.

"He's capable of playing anywhere across the defensive line, mainly being deployed in a back four for Manchester United but often on the right of a back three during his impressive loan at Accrington.

"Sonny's maturity is reflected in the leadership roles he's been given and the high esteem he's held in by United. Combined with the fact he's the son of former Plymouth defender, Hasney Aljofree, he has a very strong footballing pedigree.
"We faced strong competition from a number of League One clubs to sign him and we look forward to supporting his continued development."
The defender has just under a year remaining on his contract at Old Trafford, meaning he will be hoping to use his time at Meadow Lane to good effect.

headline: Manchester United announce signing of French striker
body: Manchester United have officially announced the signing of Enzo Kana-Biyik on a free transfer.
Kana-Biyik will immediately join Ineos-owned FC Lausanne-Sport on loan for 2025/2026. The 18-year-old is understood to have signed a long-term contract after joining from Le Havre.
United released a statement which read: "Manchester United have completed the signing of exciting young forward Enzo Kana-Biyik.
"Last season, the France youth international scored nine goals in 18 games for Le Havre's Under-19s team and earned a place on the bench for the first team on two occasions.
"Following the signing of his contract, the emerging talent has secured a loan switch to Swiss Super League side, Lausanne-Sport.
"Everyone at United would like to welcome Enzo to the club and wish him the very best of luck for his loan."
Kana-Biyik is following in the footsteps of Paul Pogba, who also joined United as a teenager from Le Havre.

The arrival of Kana-Biyik comes shortly after the signing of Diego Leon was confirmed. Leon, 18, completed a medical to finalise his move from Paraguay side Cerro Porteno in January, but the deal outlined that he would move to Old Trafford in the summer transfer window.
United agreed a £3.3million fee, rising to £7m with add-ons, with Cerro Porteno and the club believe he is another talented young player with potential to reach the first-team.

headline: Man United transfer sealed in four days after Liverpool 'took too long' to get things done
body: Manchester United legend Nemanja Vidic has revealed how close he came to joining the club’s bitter rivals Liverpool before his move to Old Trafford.

Vidic was snapped up from Spartak Moscow for £7million in December 2005 and officially joined the club a month later. The centre-back, who recently confessed his desire to become United boss in the future, had been linked with a move to Old Trafford two years earlier and soon proved why Sir Alex Ferguson had been a long-term fan of the defender.

He would go on to win 10 major honours during his eight-and-a-half years at United, including five Premier League titles and clinching the Champions League in 2008. However, Vidic has admitted that he had attracted interest from Liverpool and another Premier League side before Ferguson acted decisively to bring him to United.

“Yes, we talked [with Rafa Benítez] maybe once or twice, but nothing happened for two or three weeks,” Vidic told The Overlap, brought to you by Sky Bet. “David O’Leary wanted to bring me to Aston Villa too, but they didn’t have the money. I had dinner with David O’Leary – he came to Moscow.”

However, the decision was simple for Vidic once the United boss had contacted him. “Fergie just called me once and asked if I wanted to play for [Manchester] United, I said yes and that was done in four days," he said.

Vidic made 15 appearances in the second half of the 2005/06 campaign, but it was the following season that his partnership with Rio Ferdinand began to flourish as the team won the league title for the first time in four years. Meanwhile, it was a case of what could have been for rivals Liverpool, who signed defenders Jan Kromkamp and Daniel Agger in the January window, and a struggling Villa side.

“I was happy to go to Aston Villa, but they didn’t have money at the time – that’s what David O’Leary told me,” Vidic explained. “Liverpool were waiting too long, and Sir Alex Ferguson came in quickly and did the deal in four days.

“When I met him [Sir Alex Ferguson] was when I signed the contract with him and David Gill. The mistake I made at the time was that I said I wanted to play for United but I didn’t say for how much money!”

Remarkably, Vidic revealed that his first United contract was worth half of what he was earning at Spartak Moscow, though this was soon rectified. “For me at the time, it wasn’t about the money – I wanted to test myself,” he said. “If I wanted more money, it would’ve been better for me to stay in Moscow.

“I had double the money in Moscow than I did in Manchester when I came. Obviously, Sir Alex Ferguson and David Gill told me don’t worry and that, this contract is just the beginning, and then if I played 50 games – it doesn’t matter if it’s 5 or 10 minutes – we’ll change the contract. After 20-25 games, I signed a new contract.”

The arrival of Vidic marked another important step towards the new side Ferguson was forming to challenge Chelsea’s recent dominance under Jose Mourinho. The club had already signed Edwin van der Sar and Park Ji-sung that summer, with Patrice Evra joining alongside Vidic in January 2006. The Serbian defender became club captain in 2010, leading United to two league titles as skipper.
After the signing of Vidic was announced, Ferguson said: "Good defenders win you things. This lad is really natural and athletic. You need good defenders and that is exactly what this lad is."

headline: Hugo Ekitike, Ollie Watkins, Jamie Vardy - 7 strikers linked with Manchester United transfer
body: Manchester United are being linked with several potential new signings as the summer transfer window rolls on.

One area of the pitch that has become the centre of the transfer speculation is at centre forward. Rasmus Hojlund and Joshua Zirkzee are the current striker options at United, but there are rumours that there could be new additions to the position at Old Trafford this summer.
Matheus Cunha has been signed from Wolves, with the £62.5million new addition also capable of performing in a centre forward role.

United had hoped to sign Liam Delap from Ipswich Town this summer, but the striker instead chosen to join Chelsea in a £30million deal. As a result, United have been looking at alternate options for the centre forward position, with a host of players being linked with a move to Old Trafford.
Eintracht Frankfurt striker Hugo Ekitike has been heavily linked with a move to a new club this summer, with United mentioned as a potential destination.
Liverpool, Arsenal, Chelsea and Newcastle have also been linked with signing Ekitike this summer, who is reported to be valued at around £86million.
Sporting Lisbon striker Viktor Gyokeres was linked with a move to United at the start of the summer transfer window.

However, it has quickly become clear that Gyokeres is more likely to move to Arsenal if he is to leave Sporting this summer. There have been reports of a £70million deal on the cards, although an agreement is yet to be reached with the Gunners.
Victory Osimhen spent last season on loan at Galatasaray from Napoli, and looks set to have a permanent move this summer. United were previously interested in Osimhen before opting to sign Hojlund.

Reports in recent days have claimed that Galatasaray are interested in re-signing Osimhen this summer, this time on a permanent basis. It remains to be seen if United would be in the running for the Nigeria international who has a €75million (£65million) release clause.
Aston Villa striker Ollie Watkins has also been linked with United in recent weeks, with the speculation ramping up over the last few days.

Watkins has also been mentioned as a possible target for Newcastle this week, which is seemingly creating another transfer battle for United. The England international was also linked with Arsenal during the January transfer window.
Jamie Vardy is now a free agent after leaving Leicester City at the end of last season, with United being tentatively linked with the striker.

There were reports of Serie A outfit Genoa being interested in signing Vardy on a free transfer. However, it seems that move is not going to happen, creating speculation that a move to Old Trafford may be on the cards.
Moise Kean has been linked with a return to the Premier League over the last few months, having enjoyed a successful spell at Fiorentina last season.

United have been tentatively linked with signing Kean this summer as they continue their striker search. Kean is reported to have a £45mllion release clause in his contract, which could open a pathway to a potential transfer.
Juventus striker Dusan Vlahovic is being heavily linked with a move away from Turin this summer. United are being mentioned as a possible destination.

It remains to be seen where Vlahovic will be playing his football next season, with some reports that Juventus are willing to cancel his contract with the club and hold talks over a potential move to the Premier League. This remains speculation, of course, with United continuing to be mentioned as potentially pursuing a deal for the Serbia international.

headline: Eight players return to Manchester United for pre-season training
body: Manchester United welcomed another eight players back to Carrington on Thursday morning as the club's pre-season preparations intensified.

A total of 15 players reported back to the club's training ground on Monday for the start of pre-season training, but those who were on international duty at the end of last season were given a few days extra to enjoy some down time.
Portuguese duo Bruno Fernandes and Diogo Dalot were among the eight players to report back for pre-season training on Thursday, meaning they have returned a few days ahead of schedule.
The duo were granted an extra week off following the tragic death of international teammate Diogo Jota last week. The pair attended his funeral in Portugal last Saturday.

However, they have reported back to Carrington on their original return date, meaning they are now working alongside the rest of their teammates in preparation for United's pre-season opener against Leeds United in Stockholm on July 19.
Altay Bayindir, Patrick Dorgu, Manuel Ugarte, Rasmus Hojlund, Chido Obi and Casemiro also reported back to the club's training complex.
It means head coach Ruben Amorim is now working with almost every member of his squad at the club's training ground ahead of United's pre-season preparations going up a notch next week.

Although Marcus Rashford is understood to have trained at Carrington individually earlier this week after informing United of his desire to move on this summer, there has been no sign of Tyrell Malacia, Alejandro Garnacho, Jadon Sancho or Antony.
The quartet, alongside Rashford, informed United last week of their interest in exploring alternative options in this summer's transfer window.
United have prioritised the sales of Rashford, Sancho and Antony to bring in funds this summer.

headline: Manchester United agree first loan departure of summer transfer window
body: Manchester United youngster Sonny Aljofree has signed for Notts County on a season-long loan.
Aljofree spent last season on loan with Accrington Stanley, where he made 27 appearances, and United have moved swiftly to arrange another loan for the youngster in 2025/2026.
Notts County finished sixth in League Two last season and Accrington finished in 21st.
Aljofree impressed Notts County during his time with Accrington, who narrowly avoided relegation to the National League, and he will look to develop further at Meadow Lane.

Aljofree signed for Altrincham on a flexi-loan in the January 2024 and spent a few months around the non-league side's squad. The innovative loans allow youngsters to gain senior experience whilst remaining involved in the day-to-day environment at Carrington.
Centre-back Aljofree didn't make an appearance for Altrincham, but the flexi-loan was thought to be beneficial and prepared him to succeed during his first loan away with Accrington.
The 20-year-old was part of the FA Youth Cup-winning squad in 2022, playing alongside the likes of Kobbie Mainoo, Alejandro Garnacho and Dan Gore during that successful campaign.
Aljofree is contracted at Old Trafford until the summer of 2026.

headline: Bryan Mbeumo to Man United transfer latest as '£65m deal close' and new deadline set
body: Manchester United are still chasing a deal for Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo. The Reds are back in training this week, having secured two new signings.

United activated the £62.5 million release clause in Matheus Cunha's contract earlier this month, bringing the Wolves forward to Old Trafford on a five-year deal with an option for an extra year. Additionally, Paraguayan left-back Diego Leon has joined the club.

United's pre-season friendlies kick off against Leeds United in Stockholm on July 19. Following their trip to Sweden, they will jet off to the United States to participate in the Premier League Summer Series, where they will square off against West Ham, Bournemouth, and Everton.

There was optimism at Old Trafford that Mbeumo could link up with his potential new colleagues ahead of a pivotal pre-season for Ruben Amorim's squad. However, as of Thursday afternoon, a move has yet to materialise.
Below is a round-up of the latest reports surrounding Mbeumo's potential move to Old Trafford this summer...
The Reds' initial offer of £55m did not tempt the Bees, who are said to be holding out for a figure closer to £63m.

Reports from United In Focus claim that a deal is ‘close’ and a new completion target date has been set. It is claimed that United aim to have him on board ahead of their pre-season trip to America later this month.
Transfer insider Graeme Bailey told the website: “It is believed that talks are continuing between United and Brentford and that a deal is actually close.
“A deal in the region of £65 million is close to being agreed, although delays have mainly been around payment plans, make-up of instalments, as well as potential add-ons and bonuses.
“Old Trafford sources are of the belief that Mbeumo will be a United player sooner rather than later, indeed plans are in place for him to be a United player for their American pre-season trip.”

United have been linked with several other players in recent days amid radio silence on the club's pursuit of Mbeumo. Dominic Calvert-Lewin, Javi Guerra and Wilfred Ndidi have all been touted as targets.
Transfer reporter Fabrizio Romano took to Instagram to spill the beans on United's pursuit of Mbeumo with a fresh update.

His post said: "BREAKING: Man United remain in active talks for Bryan Mbeumo, bid to be improved! Despite no agreement reached so far with Brentford, Man United keep talks ongoing remaining confident.
"With club-to-club negotiations to continue over final details for add-ons, fee structure and more to follow. Mbeumo has been clear: he wants Man United."
Romano's scoop has raked in over 413,000 likes, including thumbs-up from two of United's own players, Matheus Cunha and Joshua Zirkzee.
Mbeumo is supposed to have told both Brentford and Tottenham he's set on a switch to United if he waves goodbye to the Bees during the hot transfer period.

Spurs' interest in Mbeumo reportedly grew after Thomas Frank made the switch from Brentford to take the reins at Tottenham. However, according to The Athletic, Mbeumo has informed both Frank and Brentford that if he leaves the Gtech Community Stadium this summer, his destination will be Old Trafford.
Former manager Frank warned in May that Mbeumo's sale would need to be for a substantial fee.

"It is clear that if he is to be sold, it must be for a nice, nice amount," he said. "It is a lot. Mucho. Really a lot. Then it is clear that it is impossible to replace him one for one. It cannot be done.
"There is a reason why he costs x number of million pounds, and we do not have x number of million pounds to buy for."

headline: Manchester United are about to be reminded about one of Erik ten Hag's biggest mistakes
body: If one decision summed up the closing stages of Erik ten Hag's Manchester United tenure, it was his call to start Toby Collyer at left-back against Barnsley last September.

United welcomed the League One side to Old Trafford in the third round of the Carabao Cup as overwhelming favourites to progress to the next round. The Reds got the job done with minimal fuss, winning 7-0.

It was the perfect opportunity for Harry Amass to be given his competitive debut. He impressed on last summer's pre-season tour, producing a crop of eye-catching performances, and the stage was set for him to make his Old Trafford bow.
Instead, Collyer - a central-midfielder - started on the left of the back four. The decision did not go down well.

Left-back was often Ten Hag's blind spot. The signing of Tyrell Malacia was questioned, the loan addition of Sergio Reguilon aged terribly, and the Dutchman even tested the water by deploying defensive-midfielder Sofyan Amrabat in that role.

On the same day United signed Reguilon and Amrabat on loan from Tottenham Hotspur and Fiorentina respectively, Alvaro Carreras was sent out on loan to Granada. He had spent the previous season on loan at Preston North End, winning their 2022/23 Young Player of the Season award.
His performances in the Championship at Deepdale often earned plaudits from North End supporters. Many felt he was destined to go onto achieve bigger and better things.

United felt the most logical next step in his career was to send him to Granada, who had just been promoted back to La Liga. He struggled for game time in Spain and moved to Benfica in January, signing on loan for the remainder of the season.

The attack-minded full-back, who is equally capable as a wing-back, got into his stride in Portugal and made 16 appearances, scoring one goal. His performances convinced Benfica to sign him on a permanent basis in May last year.

They triggered the option to turn his stay into a permanent one, and United banked a guaranteed payment of around £5million. At the time, it felt like a good deal for United, as they secured a cash-injection for a player that had never made a first-team appearance at Old Trafford.

On the flip side, United said farewell to a promising defender who had done more than enough during his time at Preston and Benfica to suggest he had something about him. That something has now put him on the cusp of a move to Real Madrid.

The Spanish club has been tracking Carreras' signature for a while and it now appears as though a deal is closer than ever to coming to fruition. It has been reported that he is closing in on a move to the Bernabeu for £43m.

Wisely, United inserted a sell-on clause into the deal that took Carreras to Benfica. They also inserted a buy-back clause which is understood to be active until the summer of 2026, allowing them to re-sign him for around £16m.
United are understood to be in line to receive 20 per cent of the profit Benfica make on the Spaniard, meaning, they will secure a little under £6m.
With the club in desperate need of cash this summer, every revenue stream will be welcomed. However, it is impossible to turn a blind eye to how badly this situation has aged for United.

Carreras established himself as a regular starter for Benfica last term, making 52 appearances, scoring four goals and contributing five assists. He made ten appearances in the Champions League and did not look out of place.

As a result of his performances at the highest level, Madrid are now making progress in their quest to sign him. His attacking nature allows him to play pretty much anywhere down the left, meaning he has versatile qualities Madrid will welcome with open arms.

Their pursuit of him will benefit United financially, but Ten Hag's refusal to give him a chance has left them short of a quality player on the pitch who could have so easily excelled in Ruben Amorim's system.

headline: Ruben Amorim can unleash a new Manchester United partnership in pre-season
body: Manchester United will get their pre-season campaign up and running when they face Leeds United in their opening friendly in Stockholm in just over a week's time.
The clash with the Whites will mark the first of five warm up matches head coach Ruben Amorim will oversee ahead of the season opener against Arsenal at Old Trafford on August 17.

United have made two first-team signings so far this summer, drafting in Matheus Cunha and Diego Leon. The former, who arrived from Wolves after his £62.5million release clause was triggered, was a top target for Amorim and will become a staple in his first-choice starting XI.
A specialist playmaker, Cunha is poised to become United's chief left-sided No.10. It means Bruno Fernandes is set to move into midfield.

Cunha, 26, scored 17 goals in all competitions for Wolves last season, netting 15 of those in the Premier League. He has a proven record in the division and that level of pedigree is something United are targeting in this summer's window.

With the width in Amorim's 3-4-2-1 formation being provided by the wing-backs, Cunha will be expected to operate in central areas and get as close to Rasmus Hojlund, or whoever else may end up spearheading United's attack, in support.

Playing in the left channel, albeit tucked in, Cunha will find himself having to develop a rapport with Patrick Dorgu. The Dane arrived at Old Trafford from Lecce earlier this year and will be hoping to kick on after a first pre-season at United.

Despite producing some up and down performances, you cannot lose sight of the fact Dorgu arrived at Old Trafford as a raw 20-year-old who had never experienced playing for a club of United's stature before. Furthermore, he was thrown straight into the starting XI with the task of operating in one of the most important and demanding positions in Amorim's system.
He was never going to be inch-perfect, especially when walking into a team midway through the season that was struggling. With a full pre-season under his belt, Dorgu has the potential to improve.

He does not turn 21 until October, meaning he is still quite some way from entering a period in his career where he should be described as the finished product. He is learning on the job and his development is in progress.

Expected to remain United's first-choice left wing-back ahead of the upcoming season, Dorgu could find himself working in tandem with Cunha. The pair of them are likely to be tasked with linking up on the left and the former will be expected to provide width and overlapping runs.

The development of their partnership could play a key role in Amorim's masterplan coming to fruition. Both players have been signed to fit his system and are expected to forge long and successful careers at Old Trafford.
United's upcoming pre-season campaign could be the birth of their on-field relationship.

headline: Bryan Mbeumo reacts to Manchester United delay as transfer plan emerges
body: Manchester United could face a busy few weeks in the summer transfer window with a host of deals that could be completed.

United have already made one new signing so far this summer with Matheus Cunha joining from Wolves in a £62.5million deal. United have until September 1 to complete their transfer business and could welcome more new additions to their squad.

Ruben Amorim will be busy preparing for his first season as United's head coach, with some of those preparations being behind the scenes as well as on the training ground. Only time will tell what deals United are able to get over the line before the forthcoming deadline.
An update has emerged around United's quest to sign Brentford star Bryan Mbeumo.
The London Evening Standard have claimed that Mbeumo has become "frustrated" by the amount of time it is taking for United and Brentford to agree a deal.

United have already made two bids for the Cameroon international this summer, both of which have been rejected by the Bees. The second bid was believed to be worth a total in excess of £60million including add-ons.
United are once again being linked with a move for Aston Villa striker Ollie Watkins.
Caught Offside have reported that United are still interested in signing the England international, but will apparently have to sell at least one star to make room in their squad.
It has been claimed that United would need to sanction Rasmus Hojlund's exit before being able to sign Watkins, which is deemed "unlikely" until the Denmark international leaves Old Trafford.

headline: Every Premier League transfer and release confirmed in the summer of 2025
body: The Premier League transfer window opened on June 1 and then closed on June 10 for six days before re-opening on Monday June 16 until Deadline Day on Monday September 1.
Here’s what we know so far…
IN: Kepa Arrizabalaga (£5m, Chelsea), Martin Zubimendi (£56m, Real Sociedad), Christian Norgaard (£10m, Brentford).

OUT: Kieran Tierney (free, Celtic), Jorginho (free, Flamengo), Nuno Tavares (£4.2m, Lazio), Marquinhos (£2.5m, Cruzeiro), Nathan Butler-Oyedeji (free, Lausanne), Thomas Partey and Takehiro Tomiyasu (both released)
OUT ON LOAN:
BACK FROM LOAN: Fabio Vieira (Porto), Reiss Nelson (Fulham), Albert Sambi Lokonga (Sevilla), Karl Hein (Real Valladolid)
IN: Yasin Ozcan (£5.9m, Kasimpasa), Zepiqueno Redmond (free, Feyenoord).
OUT: Robin Olsen (free, Malmo), Kortney Hause (released), Rico Richards (undisclosed, Port Vale), Kaine Kesler-Hayden (£3.5m, Coventry City), Philippe Coutinho (Vasco da Gama).
OUT ON LOAN: Josh Feeney (Huddersfield Town)

BACK FROM LOAN: Emiliano Buendia (Bayer Leverkusen), Alex Moreno (Nottingham Forest), Samuel Iling-Junior (Middlesbrough), Kosta Nedeljkovic (RB Leipzig), Enzo Barrenechea (Valencia), Leander Dendoncker (Anderlecht), Lewis Dobbin (Norwich), Joe Gauci (Barnsley), Filip Marschall (Crewe).
IN: Adrien Truffert (£11.4m, Rennes).
OUT: Dean Huijsen (£50m, Real Madrid), Jaidon Anthony (£8m, Burnley), Milos Kerkez (£40m, Liverpool), Joe Rothwell (£400,000, Rangers).
OUT ON LOAN: Daniel Jebbison (Preston), Max Aarons (Rangers), Jonny Stuttle (Walsall).
